CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Time dependent DFT calculations show that the absorption band in the longer wavelength is mainly attributed to the transition from HOMO delocalized in the D-A backbone to LUMO localized in DTP units for all the polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. HOMO: Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital
2. LUMO: Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital
3. D-A: Donor-Acceptor
4. DTP: Dithiophene-Thienothiophene-Phenylene (a type of conjugated polymer)

So, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are "D-A backbone" and "DTP units".
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.
The Material Name entities in the paragraph are "D-A backbone" and "DTP units".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| D-A backbone |
| DTP units |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Time dependent DFT calculations show that the absorption band in the longer wavelength is mainly attributed to the transition from HOMO delocalized in the D-A backbone to LUMO localized in DTP units for all the polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. HOMO: Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital
2. LUMO: Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital
3. D-A backbone: A conjugated polymer backbone consisting of donor (D) and acceptor (A) units.
4. DTP units: Units in the polymer consisting of DTP (dithiophene-p-phenylene) groups.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. HOMO: Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital (material property related to the electronic structure of the polymer)
2. LUMO: Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital (material property related to the electronic structure of the polymer)
3. D-A backbone: Conjugated polymer backbone (material property related to the polymer's structure)
4. DTP units: Units in the polymer consisting of DTP (dithiophene-p-phenylene) groups (material property related to the polymer's composition)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) |
| D-A backbone (conjugated polymer backbone) |
| DTP units (units in the polymer consisting of DTP (dithiophene-p-phenylene) groups) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Time dependent DFT calculations show that the absorption band in the longer wavelength is mainly attributed to the transition from HOMO delocalized in the D-A backbone to LUMO localized in DTP units for all the polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) and LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) are the Property Value entities in the given paragraph. These are electronic properties of the molecules mentioned in the paragraph. The HOMO is the last electron-filled molecular orbital in a molecule, while LUMO is the first electron-accepting molecular orbital. In this context, they are being referred to as the energy levels of the molecular orbitals in the polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. HOMO energy level and LUMO energy level are the Property Values in the given paragraph. These are the energies associated with the highest occupied molecular orbital and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital, respectively, in the polymers mentioned.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| HOMO energy level |
| LUMO energy level |
